definitions.definition: The study of crime and criminals, especially their behaviour.
A solid grip with the feet.
(by extension) A secure position from which it is difficult to be dislodged.
Airhead, beachhead, bridgehead, lodgement.
A padded or insulated bag large enough to surround the whole body and which keeps the user warm while sleeping, used as a substitute for bedclothes.
(chiefly US) A person, especially and usually (interpreted as) a male, from Latin America, a Hispanic person. (Compare Latina.)
definitions.example: Latinos have quickly become the largest ethnic minority in the United States.

definitions.definition: A warrant or petty officer on board a naval ship.
That returns rapidly to its original form (as a spring does) after being bent, compressed, stretched, etc.
definitions.example: The soft peat was springy under her feet.

definitions.definition: Lively; bouncy.
Characteristic of the spring season.
To hit with a sledgehammer.
To drag or draw a sledge.
To ride, travel with or transport in a sledge.
To verbally insult or abuse an opponent in order to distract them (considered unsportsmanlike).
The act of using a sledge to travel over snow.
The act of using a sledgehammer to bend or crush an object.
The practice of a fielder making insulting or comical references to an opposition batsman with the aim of distracting him
A name that precedes the surname.
A prefabricated home built in a factory, rather than on site, and then taken to the place where it will be occupied.
The view of the buildings of a city, usually referring to a pictured landscape.
A system of protective and pressurized clothing, together with environmental equipment, worn by astronauts when in space
A pressurized protective outfit worn by people working with extreme biohazards.
A system of government-imposed duties levied on imported or exported goods; a list of such duties, or the duties themselves.
A schedule of rates, fees or prices.
A sentence determined according to a scale of standard penalties for certain categories of crime.
To levy a duty on (something)
The energy released by a nuclear reaction; either through nuclear fission or nuclear fusion
Such energy used as a power source.
To distribute or arrange methodically; to work over and classify; to reduce to portions for ready use or application.
definitions.example: to digest laws

definitions.definition: To separate (the food) in its passage through the alimentary canal into the nutritive and nonnutritive elements; to prepare, by the action of the digestive juices, for conversion into blood; to convert into chyme.
To think over and arrange methodically in the mind; to reduce to a plan or method; to receive in the mind and consider carefully; to get an understanding of; to comprehend.
To bear comfortably or patiently; to be reconciled to; to brook.
To expose to a gentle heat in a boiler or matrass, as a preparation for chemical operations.
To undergo digestion.
definitions.example: I just ate an omelette and I'm waiting for it to digest.

definitions.definition: To suppurate; to generate pus, as an ulcer.
To cause to suppurate, or generate pus, as an ulcer or wound.
To ripen; to mature.
To quieten or reduce (a negative feeling, such as anger or grief)
That which is digested; especially, that which is worked over, classified, and arranged under proper heads or titles
A compilation of statutes or decisions analytically arranged; a summary of laws.
definitions.example: Comyn's Digest

definitions.definition: Any collection of articles, as an Internet mailing list including a week's postings, or a magazine arranging a collection of writings.
definitions.example: Reader's Digest is published monthly.

definitions.definition: The result of applying a hash function to a message.
Sitting on eggs for the purpose of hatching young; a brooding on, or keeping warm, to develop the life within, by any process.
The development of a disease from its causes, or the period of such development.
A period of little reaction which is followed by more rapid reaction.

One of the four proposed stages of creativity (preparation, incubation, illumination, and verification): the unconscious recombination of thought elements that were stimulated through conscious work at one point in time, resulting in novel ideas at a later point.
Sleeping in a temple or other holy place in order to have oracular dreams or to receive healing.
Something that is smaller than the compact version, especially a very small car.
(usually capitalized) A Shi'ite Muslim leader.
One who leads the salat prayers in a mosque.
The state of being in poor condition, in need of repair.
definitions.example: The house had fallen into such disrepair that no agent would show it to buyers.

definitions.definition: To get into a state of disrepair.
Indicates comprehension on the part of the speaker regarding a specific observation or objection raised by another.
(grammar) A form of a word that refers to only one person or thing.
That which is not general; a specific determinate instance.
Being only one of a larger population.
definitions.example: A singular experiment cannot be regarded as scientific proof of the existence of a phenomenon.

definitions.definition: Being the only one of the kind; unique.
definitions.example: She has a singular personality.

definitions.definition: Distinguished by superiority: peerless, unmatched, eminent, exceptional, extraordinary.
definitions.example: a man of singular gravity or attainments

definitions.definition: Out of the ordinary; curious.
definitions.example: It was very singular; I don't know why he did it.

definitions.definition: (grammar) Referring to only one thing or person.
(of matrix) Having no inverse.
(of transformation) Having the property that the matrix of coefficients of the new variables has a determinant equal to zero.
(of a cardinal number) Not equal to its own cofinality.
Each; individual.
definitions.example: to convey several parcels of land, all and singular

definitions.definition: Engaged in by only one on a side; single.
Either of the front feet of a quadruped.
A piece of timber terminating the keel at the fore end, connecting it with the lower end of the stem.
To repair the front area of (a shoe etc).
To catch (a horse) by binding its front legs together with rope.
Borago officinalis, a Mediterranean plant with rough, cucumber-flavored leaves, used in salads.
A ban or curse pronounced with religious solemnity by ecclesiastical authority, often accompanied by excommunication; something denounced as accursed.
(by extension) Something which is vehemently disliked by somebody.
An imprecation; a curse; a malediction.
Any person or thing anathematized, or cursed by ecclesiastical authority.
A miscarriage; an untimely birth; an abortion.
The product of a miscarriage; an aborted offspring; an abortion.
An early termination of a mission, action, or procedure in relation to missiles or spacecraft; the craft making such a mission.
definitions.example: We've had aborts on three of our last seven launches.

definitions.definition: The function used to abort a process.
An event involving the abort of a process.
definitions.example: We've had three aborts over the last two days.

definitions.definition: (now rare outside medicine) To miscarry; to bring forth (non-living) offspring prematurely.
To cause a premature termination of (a fetus); to end a pregnancy before term.
To end prematurely; to stop in the preliminary stages; to turn back.
To stop or fail at something in the preliminary stages.
To become checked in normal development, so as either to remain rudimentary or shrink away wholly; to cease organic growth before maturation; to become sterile.
To cause an organism to develop minimally; to cause rudimentary development to happen; to prevent maturation.
To abandon a mission at any point after the beginning of the mission and prior to its completion.
To terminate a mission involving a missile or rocket; to destroy a missile or rocket prematurely.
To terminate a process prior to completion.
The sea; ocean; water; flood.
An edge or border (originally specifically of the sea or a body of water).
The topmost rim or lip of a container.
definitions.example: The toy box was filled to the brim with stuffed animals.

definitions.definition: A projecting rim, especially of a hat.
definitions.example: He turned the back of his brim up stylishly.

definitions.definition: To be full to overflowing.
definitions.example: The room brimmed with people.

definitions.definition: To fill to the brim, upper edge, or top.
Of pigs: to be in heat, to rut.
Fierce; sharp; cold.
A speaker placed inside or held near to the ear.
definitions.example: Holding the earpiece to my ear, I could hear him speaking clearly.

definitions.definition: A receiver of a telephone to hold near to your ear.
The arm on a pair of glasses that hooks over the ear to hold them in place.
The act of attaining; the act of arriving at or reaching; the act of obtaining by exertion or effort.
That which is attained, or obtained by exertion; acquisition; acquirement.
Of or pertaining to style, especially to linguistic or literary style.
A type of short skin-tight shorts designed for comfort and efficiency when cycling
(usually in the plural) An item or class of items with a flour as a main ingredient, prepared by baking.
To underachieve, to not reach standards or expectations, especially with respect to a financial investment.
A piece of furniture which has multiple parallel, horizontal drawers stacked one above each other, used mainly for the storage of clean clothes.
A school where pre-school children play and learn at the same time.
A person or animal's natural height when standing upright.
Respect coming from achievement or development.
Lacking money; impecunious; in financial difficulties.
Lacking anything.
definitions.example: We were hard up for amusements.

definitions.definition: (by extension) Desperate.
definitions.example: Dating him? She must be hard up.

definitions.definition: Entertainment.
An activity that is entertaining or amusing, such as dancing, gunning, or fishing.
A merchant.
A cargo ship, engaged in commercial activities, as opposed to a warship.
A heavy iron block used in the blacksmithing trade as a surface upon which metal can be struck and shaped.
An incus bone in the middle ear.
A stone or other hard surface used by a bird for breaking the shells of snails.
The non-moving surface of a micrometer against which the item to be measured is placed.
To fashion on an anvil (often used figuratively).
Any undesirable substance or group of cells that has made its way into part of the body.
To surreptitiously penetrate, enter or gain access to.
(of a liquid) To pass through something by filtration.
To cause (a liquid) to pass through something by filtration.
To invade or penetrate a tissue or organ.
definitions.example: High-grade tumors often infiltrate surrounding structures.

definitions.definition: To send (soldiers, spies etc.) through gaps in the enemy line.
(of an intravenous needle) To move from a vein, remaining in the body.
The act of breaking up; disintegration or division.
The termination of a friendship, or a romantic relationship.
A loss of emotional control; a breakdown.
(Alaska and northern Canada) The time of year during which winter ice covering bodies of water disintegrates, or more generally Spring.
A migratory bird or other animal.
Traveller or worker who moves from one region or country to another.
An immigrant or refugee.
Any of various pierid butterflies of the genus Catopsilia. Also called an emigrant.
Migratory.
The act of fulfilling.
The state or quality of being fulfilled; completion; realization.
The act of consummating a desire or promise.
The activities performed once an order is received to fulfill the order; packaging, distributing and shipping goods.
A license or permit for absence from a college or a religious house (such as a monastery).
A permission which a bishop grants to a priest to go out of his diocese.
A variety of brown to red-brown sandstone once popular as a building material.
A row house built of brownstone, especially in New York City.
A red compound deposited during wine making; mostly potassium hydrogen tartrate - a source of cream of tartar.
A hard yellow deposit on the teeth.
A fearsome or angrily violent person.
To express one's opinion as if in an editorial, or as if it were an objective statement.
To ponder or reflect on a subject.
definitions.example: Go home, think it over and tell me your decision on Monday.

definitions.definition: A name between the given name and the family name or surname
definitions.example: I go by David but it's my middle name; my full name is William David Mason.

definitions.definition: A trait, activity, or action closely associated with or aptly describing a person
definitions.example: I won't tell anyone. "Discretion" is my middle name.

definitions.definition: One's mother's maiden name
The ratio of the speed of light in air or vacuum to that in another medium.
A cleric.
Of or pertaining to the church; ecclesiastical.
Of, or using high technology.
To deprive someone of the possession of land, especially by evicting them.
To take possession of the ball/puck etc. (from someone).
One who, or that which, reclines.
A chair hinged so that the back can be reclined for comfort.
A formal, often computerized record or log of the financial transactions of an organization or system.
(by extension) A similar record of other activities, such as actions taken by a computer system, or changes made to a document.
A martial arts uniform.
A Greek long-necked plucked fretted lute having a sharp, metallic sound
Calculation; computation.
Any formal system in which symbolic expressions are manipulated according to fixed rules.
definitions.example: lambda calculus

definitions.definition: (often definite, the calculus) Differential calculus and integral calculus considered as a single subject; analysis.
A stony concretion that forms in a bodily organ.
definitions.example: renal calculus ( = kidney stone)

definitions.definition: Deposits of calcium phosphate salts on teeth.
A decision-making method, especially one appropriate for a specialised realm.
The next or following day.
Morning.
To dawn
The puff of air accompanying the release of a plosive consonant.
A sound produced by such a puff of air.
A mark of aspiration (#) used in Greek; the asper, or rough breathing.
To remove a liquid or gas by means of suction.
To inhale so as to draw something other than air into one's lungs.
To produce an audible puff of breath. especially following a consonant.
Aspirated
To cover with a thin layer of gold; to cover with gold leaf.
To adorn.
To decorate with a golden surface appearance.
To give a bright or pleasing aspect to.
To make appear drunk.
Gold or other metal in a thin layer; gilding.
Money.
A security issued by the Bank of England (see gilt-edged)
A gilded object, an object covered with gold.
Golden coloured.
A young female pig, at or nearing the age of first breeding.
An empty-net goal.
A decentralised, radical political movement that opposes fascism.
A local instance of this movement.
Opposition to fascism
A person opposed to the tenets of fascism.
Opposed to the tenets of fascism; antifa.
To imagine or suppose (something) to be true, or to exist, without proof.
definitions.example: to suspect the presence of disease

definitions.definition: To distrust or have doubts about (something or someone).
definitions.example: to suspect the truth of a story

definitions.definition: To believe (someone) to be guilty.
definitions.example: I suspect him of being the thief.

definitions.definition: To have suspicion.
To look up to; to respect.
Believed to be a cause or at fault.
definitions.example: Bring in the suspected vandal.

definitions.definition: To formulate a theory, especially about some specific subject.
To speculate.
Rose-coloured.
Resembling rose, as in scent of perfume.
Optimistic.
Tea
definitions.example: I fancy a cup of rosy lee.

definitions.definition: Something given to the poor as charity, such as money, clothing or food.
definitions.example: Alms are distributed from the weekly collection for the purpose.

definitions.definition: A general feeling of anxiety, fear, uneasiness, or nausea.
definitions.example: I don't mind worms, but spiders give me the heebie-jeebies.

definitions.definition: Sexual intercourse by a married person with someone other than their spouse.
definitions.example: She engaged in adultery because her spouse has a low libido, while hers is very high.

definitions.definition: Lewdness or unchastity of thought as well as act, as forbidden by the seventh commandment.
Faithlessness in religion.
The fine and penalty formerly imposed for the offence of adultery.
The intrusion of a person into a bishopric during the life of the bishop.
(political economy) Adulteration; corruption.
Injury; degradation; ruin.
Any of many flat biscuits, or cakes, made from oatmeal.
Any of various species of black, grey, or white seabirds in the order Procellariiformes.
Of, belonging or relating to an occupation (in any sense).
definitions.example: Boredom is an occupational hazard if you are a checkout girl.

definitions.definition: The act of confining, or the state of being confined; imprisonment.
Strangulation, as in hernia.
A constriction of the hernial sac, rendering it irreducible, but not great enough to cause strangulation.

An evergreen coniferous tree with flattened shoots bearing small scale-like leaves, whose dark foliage is sometimes associated with mourning, in family Cupressaceae, especially the genera Cupressus and Chamaecyparis.
A thin, translucent, usually black fabric, a kind of crape.
A device, located by a parking space, that collects payment in exchange for the right to park a vehicle for a specified time.
To be, or cause to be, reborn, especially in a different body or as a different species.
Any freshwater or marine fish of the order Anguilliformes, which are elongated and resemble snakes.
The European eel, Anguilla anguilla.
To fish for eels.
To move with a sinuous motion like that of an eel.
Any remedy that aids recuperation.
In the way of recuperation.
definitions.example: Obtaining recuperative rest is aided by quiet, not by having ambulance sirens go by every five minutes.

definitions.definition: To grow beyond one's boundaries or containment, or beyond the proper size.
To grow over; (of one thing) to cause (a second thing) to become overgrown (with or by the first thing).
Having large numbers of plants which have become too big, and are hence spoiling the picturesqueness of a garden.
Having grown bigger without developing maturity or changing character.
definitions.example: He spends so much money on new technology: he's like an overgrown schoolboy buying toys.

definitions.definition: (authorship) The main character, or one of the main characters, in any story, such as a literary work or drama.
A leading person in a contest; a principal performer.
An advocate or champion of a cause or course of action.
An echidna.
Inflexible and not yielding
Very reserved, aloof and asocial
To remove a bend so as to make, or allow to become, straight
definitions.example: to unbend a bow

definitions.definition: To release (a load) from a strain or from exertion; to set at ease for a time; to relax.
definitions.example: to unbend the mind from study or care

definitions.definition: To unfasten sails from the spars or stays to which are attached for use.
To cast loose or untie
definitions.example: Unbend the rope.

definitions.definition: To cease to be bent; to become straight.
To relax in exertion, attention, severity, or the like
To enjoy oneself; to become affable and free from formality
The act of one who unbends.
To assert or promote one's opinion; to make one's thoughts known.
definitions.example: You should learn to speak out in meetings with your boss.
